greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let n = 2^e_2 * 3^e_ * 5^e_ * ... be the prime factorization of n; then a(n) = largest prime <= 1 + max{e_2, e_3, e_5, ...}; a(1) = 1 by convention.
link: David Applegate and N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: pp := proc(n) local f,m; option remember;
program: (PARI) a(n) = if (n==1, 1, precprime(1 + vecmax(factor(n)[,2]~))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 14 2018
results.author: _David Applegate_ and _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 15 2008
